class CGroupManager

Detailed Description

An item which implements functions to get the module of this item.

An item which implements functions to get the module of this item. The constructor gets the required arguments to operate

Author:
Joachim Ansorg <jansorg@gmx.de>

Definition at line 43 of file cgroupmanageritem.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CGroupManagerItem::CGroupManagerItem (  CGroupManager *    parent,
const QString &    caption,
const QString &    modulename,
CSwordModuleInfo *    module_info,
CSwordKey *    bookmarkKey = 0,
CGroupManagerItem::itemType    Type = CGroupManagerItem::Module
) 
 

The constructor.

This constructor takes a CGroupManager as parent, the created item will be on the top of the tree.

Parameters:
parent  The CGRoupManager which will contain the new item
caption  The caption of the item. This parameter will eb passes to
See also:
init()
Parameters:
modulename  The name of our module. This is used in addition to the CModuleInfo object because sometimes the moduleinfo is missing and we don't want to loose bookmarks.
module_info  The CModuleInfo object we use for the item. May be zero because a group doesn't have a CModuleInfo.
Type  The type of the created item. May ba Module, Bookmark or Group. If you leave out the parameter it will be Module by default.

) 
 

The constructor.

This constructor takes a CGroupManagerItem as parent. The created item will be on a child of the parent item

Parameters:
parent  The CGroupManagerItem which will be parent item of the new item
caption  The caption of the item. This parameter will eb passes to
See also:
init()
Parameters:
modulename  The name of our module. This is used in addition to the CModuleInfo object because sometimes the moduleinfo is missing and we don't want to loose bookmarks.
module_info  The CModuleInfo object we use for the item. May be zero because a group doesn't have a CModuleInfo.
Type  The type of the created item. May ba Module, Bookmark or Group. If you leave out the parameter it will be Module by default.
